item.title: Alaska Native Claims Settlement Improvement Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 115-502.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

summary.text:
ANCSA Nagamut Group Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017

This bill amends the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act to require the Department of Interior to pay Nagamut Limited, an Alaska Native group, the fair market value of the unconveyed surface estate of 6,080 acres of land Nagamut selected on September 18, 1975, and Calista Corporation, an Alaska Native regional corporation, the fair market value of the subsurface estate under Nagamut's selection.

The bill provides funds to compensate Nagamut and Calista.

The compensation paid to Nagamut and Calista satisfies Nagamut's statutory land entitlement and Calista's rights to the subsurface estate under the Act.

bill.title: ANCSA Nagamut Group Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017

item.title: ANCSA Nagamut Group Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017
A bill to amend the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act regarding the Nagamut selection, and for other purposes.
ANCSA Nagamut Group Land Conveyance Settlement Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
